sound
Class SequencePlayer

java.lang.Object
  sound.SequencePlayer

public class SequencePlayer
extends java.lang.Object

Schedules and plays a sequence of notes at given time steps (or "ticks")

Constructor Summary
SequencePlayer(int beatsPerMinute, int ticksPerQuarterNote)
           
 
Method Summary
 void addNote(int note, int startTick, int numTicks)
           
static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
          play an octave up and back down starting from middle C addNote(base, tick, duration) schedules a note with pitch value 'base' starting at 'tick' to be played for 'duration' number of ticks For example, addNote(new Pitch('C').toMidiNote(), 10, 1) plays the middle C at time step 10 for half the duration of a quarter note.
 void play()
           
 java.lang.String toString()

SequencePlayer

public SequencePlayer(int beatsPerMinute,
                      int ticksPerQuarterNote)
               throws javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException,
                      javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
Parameters:
beatsPerMinute - : the number of beats per minute, where each beat is equal to a quarter note in duration
ticksPerQuarterNote - : the number of ticks per quarter note
Throws:
javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException
javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
Method Detail

addNote

public void addNote(int note,
                    int startTick,
                    int numTicks)
Parameters:
note - : the pitch value for the note to be played
startTick - : the starting tick
numTicks - : the number of ticks for which this note should be played

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
play an octave up and back down starting from middle C addNote(base, tick, duration) schedules a note with pitch value 'base' starting at 'tick' to be played for 'duration' number of ticks For example, addNote(new Pitch('C').toMidiNote(), 10, 1) plays the middle C at time step 10 for half the duration of a quarter note.
